Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery Panathenaic amphora; interior: glazed dull black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of Doric column with cock to right, beginning of painted inscription and part of Athena's spear and shield.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For a parallel regarding the iconography, see British Museum 1842,0517.2.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 247-8, no. B140)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0043) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 95, pl. II, no. 27)
Hogarth, Lorimer & Edgar 1905 / Naukratis 1903 (p. 121, pl. VII, no. 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
